page.title: 11Landscapes & Buildings cont.
page.content: At this time no deeds for the building could be traced and after 12 years new ones were prepared. In 1963 it was handed over to a Board of Trustees but is now run by a Committee, members representing the organisations in the village. They run various social events, dances, games evenings and jumble sales, to raise money for repairs and running costs and have recently spent over Â£2000 on damp proofing and exterior rendering. It is used by the Women's Institute and the Chapel and can be hired for private functions. There is a separate building housing 2 toilets & wash basins and the main hall has a small kitchen attached.
